popover.title: Welcome
popover.description: Hey there! Welcome to the intro tour. This is the Onboarding Pilot which will guide you through the application.

popover.title: Welcome
popover.description: This should not get too tiring, so we will keep it short with just a rough overview of some main functions.

popover.title: Welcome
popover.description: If a blinking arrow shows up, it is needed to execute a click or touch from your side.

popover.title: Welcome
popover.description: Let’s not waste any time and start with the first section …

popover.title: Your personal inbox
popover.description: The dashboard functions as your personal inbox. Here you can see all kind of invites, your notifications, and your favourites.

popover.title: Your inbox
popover.description: For now it is quite empty here but when any other users want to /chat with you or want to work collaboratively on a /write document, you can find your notification here.

popover.title: Your inbox
popover.description: If there are things to catch up for you, a small dot will appear next to the /dashboard link in the main navigation.

popover.title: Your inbox
popover.description: Maybe you got already invited to some spaces. If that’s the case you can accept those. With the click on the underlined name you will be redirected to the space.

popover.title: Your inbox
popover.description: But first, let’s see what’s going on in this application. Let’s go to the /explore page next …

popover.title: Your spaces
popover.description: First of all we will start with the /explore page. This is where you can find all the spaces structured by their context.

popover.title: Your spaces
popover.description: You can navigate from level to level and see what is going on in the different contexts.

popover.title: Your spaces
popover.description: Let’s click on the entry level and traverse down the tree.

popover.title: Communicate
popover.description: One of the major functionalities is /chat. Here you can communicate with others in real time: in one-to-one chats, or in group chats.

popover.title: Communicate
popover.description: All your chats will be listed here. It will be separated in private chats and group chats.

popover.title: Communicate
popover.description: If you want to create a new chat, just click the button at the top.

popover.title: Communicate
popover.description: You can select to create either a direct message, or a group chat.

popover.title: Communicate
popover.description: For group chats, you can set the visibility of the chat room. Do you want to make the room public to all udk accounts, or just to the invited ones.

popover.title: Encrypted
popover.description: Be aware of the the end-to-end encryption. If you choose to enable this option, all participants will need to have their encryption key stored.

popover.title: Encrypted
popover.description: Be aware of the the end-to-end encryption. If you choose to enable this option, all participants will need to have their encryption key stored.

popover.title: Contextualize
popover.description: Anyway, after creating a groupchat, you can later assign it to a specific context via /explore, … just like a file or a document in your operating system.

popover.title: Going on
popover.description: Speaking of documents, let’s go to the /write tool next …

popover.title: Let’s create some items.
popover.description: With the /write tool you can create some collaborative text documents.

popover.title: Create it
popover.description: Let’s create a new document, just as an example, as right now it looks quite empty here. Please press the add button at the top.

popover.title: Name it
popover.description: First of all, give the document a name. It will be visible to others.

popover.title: Protect it
popover.description: If you want to protect it from being seen by others, who know or guess the document address, you can set a password.

popover.title: Submit it
popover.description: Press the button and *tada* you have created a document. You can now edit it and invite others to join.

popover.title: Library
popover.description: From now on you can find all the documents you created in /write. Quite handy, isn’t it?

popover.title: Contextualize
popover.description: Don’t forget that you can also add your documents to some context in /explore to make them visible to others in the specfic contexts.

popover.title: Show yourself
popover.description: Next stop: your /account. This is where you can personalize your profile, how it will be seen by others.

popover.title: What’s your name?
popover.description: You can change your display name to anything you want to. But be aware, your official username, i.e. account address, will still be visible to others.

popover.title: Profile picture
popover.description: How about adding a photo? It will be visible to others for example in /chat.
We are heading towards the end of this onboarding tour. Let’s go back to /explore once more.

popover.title: Browse and add
popover.description: Browse around the structure, request access, or add further contexts or items, which you are interested in, to your own spaces.

popover.title: Missing something?
popover.description: If there isn’t that much content, yet, tell others in your institution to join udk/spaces and contribute.

popover.title: More?
popover.description: There are many other functions to use. Just have a look around and try them out.

popover.title: Finished!
popover.description: That’s all for now. You can restart the onboarding at any time via /account. Have fun!
